medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr M had an acute anterior myocardial infarction (MI) 7 years ago. Following the MI, he underwent successful stent placement and had a post-MI echocardiogram showing a left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) of 25%. He has been without chest pain, shortness of breath, or palpitations since then, but notes diminished exercise capacity compared to his pre-MI capabilities.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of myocardial infarction (MI), low ejection fraction (LVEF of 25%), and congestive heart failure (CHF). He is currently being treated for hyperlipidemia.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at 53 years of age from recurrent myocardial infarctions (MIs).
medical_history.social_history: Works as a car salesman, lives alone, drinks alcohol rarely, and does not smoke.
